cards.task: Create a new version of the script
cards.description: Creates an immutable snapshot of your current script code as a numbered version.
cards.whenToUse: When you want to create a stable reference point before deploying.
scenarios: Pre-deployment: Creating a version with a description before deploying
Release tagging: Marking milestones like 'v2.0 - Added user authentication'
Safe refactoring: Creating a version before major changes for easy rollback

cards.task: List all versions of a script project
cards.description: Shows all saved versions with their numbers, descriptions, and creation dates.
cards.whenToUse: When you need to review version history or find a specific version number.
scenarios: Version audit: Reviewing the history of your project
Rollback planning: Finding the version number of a stable release
Documentation: Getting version information for release notes

cards.description: Publishes your script as a deployment that can be used as a web app, API executable, or add-on.
cards.whenToUse: When you want to create a production version that end-users can access.
scenarios: Web app release: Deploying a new version for users to access via URL
API deployment: Creating an API executable for external services
Add-on publishing: Deploying a new version for testing or production

cards.description: Creates a deployment using a specific saved version instead of the latest code.
cards.whenToUse: When deploying to production and you want to use a specific tested version.
scenarios: Controlled releases: Deploying version 23 that passed QA, not untested code
Rollback capability: Creating deployment from the last stable release
Multi-environment: Deploying version 22 to staging while production stays on v20

cards.task: List all deployment versions for a script
cards.description: Displays all active deployments showing IDs, versions, and descriptions.
cards.whenToUse: When you need to see what versions are currently deployed.
scenarios: Version audit: Checking which versions are live before deploying updates
Deployment management: Getting deployment IDs to undeploy or redeploy
Troubleshooting: Verifying users are accessing the intended version

cards.task: Update an existing deployment with new code
cards.description: Updates an existing deployment to point to new code while maintaining the same URL.
cards.whenToUse: When you want to update a deployed version without changing the URL.
scenarios: Seamless updates: Updating your web app without changing bookmarked URLs
Production releases: Pushing new features while maintaining the same endpoint
Bug fixes: Quickly updating a live deployment with a critical fix

cards.description: Removes a specific deployment, making it inaccessible to users.
cards.whenToUse: When you need to retire an old version or remove a buggy deployment.
scenarios: Version retirement: Undeploying old versions after users migrate to new release
Emergency rollback: Quickly removing a buggy deployment
Deployment cleanup: Removing test deployments

cards.description: Removes every deployment for the script in one command.
cards.whenToUse: When you want to clean up all deployments and start fresh.
scenarios: Fresh start: Removing all old test deployments before production deploy
Project sunset: Decommissioning a project by removing all deployments
Cleanup: Too many test deployments accumulated

cards.task: Open the deployed web app in browser
cards.description: Opens a specific deployment of your web app in your browser.
cards.whenToUse: When you want to quickly test or view a deployed version.
scenarios: Deployment testing: Opening a new deployment to verify it works
Version comparison: Opening different deployment IDs to compare behavior
Quick access: Launching your web app without copying the URL manually
